intro: Erigeron janivultus, commonly known as the plains coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the central and northern Great Plains of North America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, roadsides, and disturbed soils. The plant features basal leaves that are linear to lance-shaped and hairy, with showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer. Its flowering heads are composed of ray flowers surrounding a central disk, typical of the Asteraceae family. Erigeron janivultus is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in areas with full sun.
